LEGAL BULLETIN
OF NICOLAUS COPERNICUS UNIVERSITY IN TORUN
Year 2023; Item 83
ORDER No. 46
Rector of the Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń
of March 27, 2023.
on the organization of the academic year 2023/2024
Pursuant to Article 23 (1) of the Act of July 20, 2018. Law on higher education and science
and Science (Journal of Laws of 2022, item 574, as amended) and § 12 of Resolution No. 39 of the Senate of the University of Toruń dated 30
April 2019. Regulations of the Rules of Studies of the Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń (Bulletin
Legal Bulletin of the Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń 2019, item 277, as amended).
it is ordered as follows:
§ 1
1 The framework org anization of the academic year 2023/2024 in the Toruń and Bydgoszcz parts is established
Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń
WINTER SEMESTER from October 1, 2023 to February 19, 2024.
Inauguration of the academic year 202 3/2024 October 2, 2023.
Teaching classes from October 3, 2023 to December 22, 2023.
Winter vacation from December 23, 2023 to January 7, 2024.
Teaching classes from January 8, 2024 to February 5, 2024.
Winter examination session from February 6, 2024 to February 18, 2024.
UNIVERSITY HOLIDAY February 19, 2024.
Winter examination-correction session from February 20, 2024 to March 4, 2024.
SUMMER SEMESTER from February 20, 2024 to September 30, 2024.
Teaching classes from February 20, 2024 to March 28, 2024.
Spring vacation from March 29, 2024 to April 2, 2024.
Teaching classes from April 3, 2024 to June 14, 2024.
Summer examination session from June 15, 2024 to June 28, 2024.
Summer vacation from June 29, 2024 to September 30, 2024.
Corrective examination session from September 1, 2024 to September 14, 2024.
(2) In order to allow the implementation of classes in accordance with the study plan, it is established that:
1) April 3 (Wednesday) 2024 classes scheduled for Friday will be held ;
2) On May 14 (Tuesday) 2024, classes scheduled for Friday will be held.
§ 2
(1) Days off from teaching shall be the following days off from work
within the meaning of the Act of January 18, 1951 on public holidays (Dz. U. 2020,
item 1920):
1) November 1, 2023 (All Saints' Day);
2) November 11, 2023 (National Independence Day);
3) January 6, 2024 (Epiphany);
4) May 1, 2024 (National Holiday);
5) May 3, 2024 (National Day of the Third of May);
6) May 19, 2024 (Pentecost);
7) May 30, 2024 (Corpus Christi).
(2) Additional days off from teaching are:
1) October 2, 2023 (inauguration of the academic year);
2) October 30-31, 2023;
3) November 2-3, 2023;
4) May 2, 2024;
5) May 10-12, 2024 (the Juvenalia);
6) May 31, 2024.
§ 3
(1) Teaching schedules for full-time studies shall be established by the units conducting the studies,
and the deans of the faculties shall approve and announce them in the USOS system or on the website of the
faculty no later than 10 days before the beginning of the semester.
(2) Meeting dates and class schedules for part-time studies shall be established by the units conducting the studies
studies, and deans of faculties shall approve and announce them in the USOS system or on the faculty website no later than
faculty website no later than 10 days before the beginning of the semester.
(3) Changes in class schedules and dates of assemblies may be made only with the approval of the
dean.
(4) The dean shall inform, without undue delay, students and instructors of the introduced
changes referred to in paragraph 3, respectively, in USOS or on the website of the
faculty.
§ 4
The dean of the faculty, after consultation with the faculty council of student government, may establish
other dates for the examination session, for students in their last semester of study, provided that
implementation of the full educational program is guaranteed.
2
§ 5
In particularly justified cases, the rector, at the request of the dean, after consultation with the
opinion of the appropriate student government body, may give permission for a given course of study to organize credit and
course of study for credit and examinations on a continuous basis.
§ 6
The Ordinance enters into force on October 1, 2023.
REKTOR
prof. dr. hab. Andrzej Sokala
